Questions.QuestionString: On RMP, the LCD active window displays the: (level 2)
Answers: Standby frequency or the course in back-up navigation mode.
Operational frequency or the course in back-up navigation mode.

Questions.QuestionString: What is function of Push To Talk (PTT) button (level 2)
Answers: Connect audio signal to transceiver and switch reception to transmission

Questions.QuestionString: The audio control panels (ACP) are used for the: (level 2)
Answers: Control of the received audio signal levels.
Selection of communication systems (in transmission and reception) and for the control of the received audio signal levels.
Selection of communication systems (in transmission and reception)

Questions.QuestionString: The flight interphone system allows communication between the: (level 2)
Answers: Flight crew and the ground mechanic only.
Flight crew members, and between the flight crew and the ground mechanic.

Questions.QuestionString: How many transmission channel can be selected at a time: (level 2)
Three green bars illuminated on the ACP’S VHF 2 key means: (level 2)
Answers: A SELCAL is received on VHF 2

From where you can select frequencies for radio systems? (level 2)

How is the audio signal from acoustic equipment connected to AMU (level 2)
Answers: Audio signal from acoustic equipment is not connected to AMU

Questions.QuestionString: The radio management panels (RMP) are used for the selection of: (level 2)
If the flight crew needs to maintain contact and communicate with the mechanic, the flight crew can push: (level 2)
Answers: The GROUND pushbutton on the CALLS panel on the overhead,
The MECH pushbutton on the CALLS panel on the overhead,
The MECH transmission key and reception knob on Audio Control Panels (ACPs)

Questions.QuestionString: The RAD position of the INT/RAD selector switch is: (level 2)
The INT/RAD selector switches to the INT position: (level 2)
Answers: This position enables permanent use of the flight interphone without any further reaction and whatever radio key is selected.
This position acts like the selection of the hand microphone pushbutton or the Push To Talk trigger on the side-stick.
This position is momentary contact to passenger address.

Questions.QuestionString: The INT/RAD selector switch in INT position, when can direct flight interphone transmission be allowed? (level 2)
Answers: The transmission key is selected and no Push-To-Talk switch is activated
No transmission key is selected or the transmission key is selected and no Push-To-Talk switch is activated

Questions.QuestionString: The Communication between flight crew and ground mechanic is: (level 2)
Which acoustic equipment send audio signal to AMU when cockpit man set INT/RAD selector switch to the INT position to operates direct flight interphone: (level 2)
For A320 family aircraft. How many service interphone jacks? (level 2)
How many type of interphone (level 2)
What is reason for the service interphone system is disabled when the weight off wheels? (level 2)
Answers: It might not be necessary to communicate between personnel at various points around the aircraft when jacking the aircraft
To eliminate potential static noise generated and amplified through the AMU due to the length of wires acting as antenna into the audio system.

Questions.QuestionString: For RMP interface, what are the dialog buses used for? (level 3)
Answers: Exchange of information between the three RMPs.

Questions.QuestionString: What happens if RMP1 fails? (level 3)
Answers: All communication frequencies can be controlled by using RMP2 or RMP 3 .

Questions.QuestionString: If two RMPS fail, the remaining RMP controls: (level 3)
What is purpose of RMP (level 3)
Answers: Selection of radio communication frequencies and selection of interphone system frequencies
Selection of radio communication frequencies and selection of radio navigation frequencies as back−up of the Flight Management Guidance Computers (FMGCs).

Questions.QuestionString: The audio switching selector is used for the: (level 3)
Answers: Selection of various items of acoustic equipment.
Control of the received audio signal levels.
Reconfiguration of channels, in case of ACP failure.

Questions.QuestionString: What is function of the AUDIO SWITCHING selector? (level 3)
Answers: Is used in case of communication failure on CAPT or F/O channels.
Is used in case of boomset failure on CAPT or F/O side.
Is used in case of handset failure on CAPT or F/O side.

Questions.QuestionString: How can the Captain control audio when ACP 1 failed: (level 3)
The audio switching selector is used in case of communication failure on CAPT or F/O channels. when switch set to CAPT 3: (level 3)
Answers: The CAPT will use the 3rd occupant ACP. The 3rd occupant audio equipment cannot be used.
The CAPT will use the 3rd occupant ACP. The 3rd occupant audio equipment still can be used.

Questions.QuestionString: How is CAPT’s acoustic equipment audio line connected when AUDIO SWITCHING selector is switched to CAPT 3 position: (level 3)
Answers: CAPT’s acoustic equipment audio line is connected to 3rd occupant ACP
CAPT’s acoustic equipment audio line is connected to AMU
CAPT’s acoustic equipment audio line is connected to 3rd occupant RMP

Questions.QuestionString: When is the muting circuit operative? (level 3)
Answers: The muting circuit always mutes the audio output
The muting circuit is operative only with the hand microphone selection
The muting circuit is operative when any microphone is keyed to transmit

Questions.QuestionString: What is purpose of muting circuit: (level 3)
Answers: To avoid acoustic coupling between the loudspeakers and the microphones.
To avoid acoustic coupling between the Flight Warning Computer (FWC) audio outputs and the microphones.
To avoid noisy from high power engine running.

Questions.QuestionString: Which does transceiver uses the coupler? (level 3)

Visual and aural indications to the crew, concerning calls received from ground stations through VHF and HF systems.
A/C identification for ATC ground stations.

Questions.QuestionString: The SELCAL code panel is installed in the: (level 3)
The reset key on ACPS is used to: (level 3)
When a selective calling is established, on the ACP: (level 3)
The SELCAL code is used for: (level 3)

SELCAL provides: (level 3)

Visual and aural indication of calls received from ground stations and other aircrafts

Answers: Extinguish the buzzer sound when the call is coming

Questions.QuestionString: Which equipment provide SELCAL function (level 3)

Answers: After 60 seconds if the call is not cancelled by the RESET key
When transmission on the called channel is done
CALL lights of transmission key on ACP can not go off automatically.

Answers: At lease a reception knob on an ACP pops out (reception channel is selected).
At lease a transmission key on an ACP is pressed.
The code of SELCAL signal and the code programmed on the SELCAL code panel are agree.

Questions.QuestionString: When a SELCAL call is received, which unit generates the buzzer signal? (level 3)
When the cockpit call pushbutton (on the 108vu) is pressed in: (level 3)
Answers: The MECH light flashes amber on all ACPs and a buzzer is heard.
The MECH light flashes amber on all ACPs and a horn sounds is heard.
The CALL light flashes amber on all ACPs and a buzzer is heard.

Questions.QuestionString: Which lights on ACPS go off automatically after 60 seconds if the call is not cancelled by the reset key: (level 3)
When Mechanic calls to cockpit from the External Power panel: (level 3)
Answers: This will cause a buzzer sound in the cockpit, and the MECH light on the ACP come on.
This will cause a buzzer sound in the cockpit, and the CALL light on the ACP come on.

Questions.QuestionString: The MECH light on the ACP’S key flashes amber to indicate a: (level 3)
How do you cancel ATT legend on the ACP? (level 3)
Answers: push RESET pushbutton on the ACP.
It is automatically cancelled after 60 second
By Push the Reset PB on ACP or it can be automatic cancelled after 60 seconds

Questions.QuestionString: The INT/RAD selector switch on ACP permits the utilization of the: (level 2)
Answers: Interphone when the boomsets or oxygen masks are used by the crew.
Interphone or the radio communication, when the boomsets or oxygen masks are used by the crew.
Radio communication when the boomsets or oxygen masks are used by the crew.

Questions.QuestionString: The frequency of selected radio system is displayed on: (level 2)
Answers: The active window of Radio Management Panel (RMP),
The standby window of Radio Management Panel (RMP),
The active window of Audio Control Panel (ACP),

Questions.QuestionString: What is main purpose of transmission key on ACP? (level 2)
Answers: To connect the transmission line to the chosen transmitter, when the corresponding transmission key is pressed in.
Select transmission channel and display various calls received through SELCALsystem

Questions.QuestionString: The purpose of the static discharges is to: (level 1)
Answers: Discharge static electricity and to prevent interference of communication systems.

Questions.QuestionString: What is purpose of static dischargers? (level 1)
Answers: To discharge the static electricity accumulated by the aircraft during its flight,
To supply better intelligibility on the HF and VHF system,
To discharge the static electricity accumulated by the aircraft during its flight and supply better intelligibility on the HF and VHF system

Questions.QuestionString: What is main purpose of the static dischargers: (level 1)
Answers: To avoid static electricity discharging noise and ensure a good quality of radio transmission, without interference.
To improve performance of VHF antenna

Questions.QuestionString: When does ECAM show message “HF1 EMITTING”? (level 3)
Answers: When a HF transceiver 1 (XCVR) emits for more than 60 seconds.
When a HF transceiver 1 (XCVR) has a failure.

Questions.QuestionString: What does the Warning message “COM VHF1 EMITTING” mean? (level 3)
Answers: VHF1 transceiver emits for more than 60 seconds
VHF1 can not transmit signal for communication.

Questions.QuestionString: The ACARS system normally use: (level 3)

36. Which system is mainly dedicated to the ACARS Data Link System? (level 3)

Answers: A window display ACARS, a window display dashes
A window display ACARS, a window display frequency for voice communication

Questions.QuestionString: How is a SATCOM antenna beam steered? (level 3)
Answers: SATCOM antenna do not need to be steered, even though SATCOM is used to provide high data rate communications

Questions.QuestionString: How does an Intermediate Gain Antenna (SATCOM antenna) control beam steering (level 3)
Which data does the ADIRS provide for SATCOM Antenna Beam Steering? (level 3)
The CVR is automatically energized: (level 3)
Answers: In flight or on the ground when at least one engine is running or on the ground during the first five minutes following energization of the aircraft electrical network or on the ground up to five minutes after second engine shutdown.
On ground only when at least one engine is running and for 5 minutes after the last engine is shut down.

Questions.QuestionString: Which is unit used for recording the flight crew conversations, communications and aural warnings? (level 3)
Answers: DFRC in case of SSCVR has failure.

Questions.QuestionString: When does the SSCVR operate? (level 3)
Answers: On the ground with at least one engine running.
When has energization of the aircraft electrical network?

Questions.QuestionString: The cockpit voice recorder (CVR) records: (level 3)
Answers: In-flight and on-ground crew radio communications.
In-flight and on-ground crew conversations and radio communications.

Questions.QuestionString: When can you erase the SSCVR? (level 3)
Answers: When aircraft on the ground, right and left main landing gear shock absorbers compressed and parking brake applied.
When at leat one Engine shutdown.

Questions.QuestionString: Is installation of CVR in modern aircraft mandatory (level 3)
How many recording channels are there in a CVR? (level 3)
When is CVR manual erasure of the recording enable? (level 3)
Answers: A/C on ground with parking brake applied.
A/C on ground with parking brake released.

Questions.QuestionString: With the switch in the AUTO position, how can the fixed ELT be automatically activated? (level 3)
How is aircraft identification data transferred into fixed ELT? (level 3)
Answers: Automatically, when the programming unit is connected to the ELT

Questions.QuestionString: When is a fixed ELT automatic operation triggered: (level 3)
Answers: A maintenance-dongle which has a maintenance identification data code programmed in its memory is connected to fixed ELT.
Fixed ELT auxiliary-antenna is wet by salt water.
Fixed the ELT is connected to its system in the A/C, and the G-switch detects an impact sufficient.

Questions.QuestionString: The AUTO/OFF/ON switch (located on the front face of the ELT) is set to ON position for manual operation: (level 3)
Answers: When the ELT is connected to its system in the A/C
When the ELT is disconnected from its system in the A/C
When the ELT is connected to its system in the A/C and you do a self-test (BITE), or when the ELT is disconnected from its system, removed from the A/C and used in portable mode.

Questions.QuestionString: Set The ON/OFF/ARM switch on the ELT panel to ARM, the ELT automatic operation is triggered when the ELT is connected to its system in the A/C and thank to: (level 3)
The type A DEUS provide the interface between the: (level 3)
Answers: Directors and the passenger related systems.
Directors and the attendant and cabin related systems.

Questions.QuestionString: The forward attendant panel (FAP) is located in the: (level 2)
Answers: Aft entrance area of the aircraft.
Forward entrance area of the aircraft.
Close to the emergency exit doors.

Questions.QuestionString: A/C in normal configuration: (level 3)
Answers: CIDS Director 1 is active, CIDS Director 2 is standby.
CIDS Director 2 is active, CIDS Director 1 is standby.
CIDS Director 1 is active for DEU A, CIDS Director 2 is active for DEU B.

Questions.QuestionString: What does CIDS On Board Replaceable Module (OBRM) define: (level 3)
The central units of the CIDS consist of: (level 3)
In normal operation director 1 is supplied by: (level 3)
What happens if the DC essential bus fails? (level 3)
Answers: The service bus supplies both directors
The DEUs are no longer supplied.

Questions.QuestionString: Which is the main unit if the CIDS? (level 3)
How does CIDS works when service bus unavailable? (level 3)
Answers: Circuitry in the directors and DEUs switches the essential circuits to essential bus
The DIR 2, the non-essential DEU B circuits and the FAP are inoperative
The second DIR, the non-essential DEU circuits and the FAP are inoperative

Questions.QuestionString: When are all CIDS units, which are supplied by essential bus, switched automatically to the hot battery bus? (level 3)
Answers: The aircraft loses main power and the emergency exit lights switch is set to ARM or ON

Questions.QuestionString: What is role of Director 2 in normal operation of the CIDS? (level 3)
If the self-test of director fails: (level 3)
Answers: Director 1 is switched to emergency mode.
The top line data buss are switched off

Questions.QuestionString: If the Director 1 fails, what happens? (level 3)
Answers: Director 2 takes over and provides the PA function only.
The DEU A are disconnected, due to the TOP CUT OFF relay
Director 2 provides automatically all the CIDS functions

Questions.QuestionString: Which CIDS Director is active in normal operation? (level 3)
How does the outputs of the Director in stand-by mode work? (level 3)
Answers: Same as outputs of the Director in active mode

Questions.QuestionString: Each type of DEU A interface with: (level 3)
Main task of DEU is to: (level 3)
Answers: Interface between directors and aircraft systems
Interface between directors and cabin systems

Questions.QuestionString: A bus termination resistor used to impedance matching is installed (level 3)
Answers: on the first DEU mount of each line
On the last DEU of each line.
on the last DEU mount of each line

Questions.QuestionString: What do you necessary do when replace DEU mount? (level 3)
Answers: Select the same code as used before on the coding switch.
Set code as seri number of new DEU mount.

Questions.QuestionString: Where are the coding switches located? (level 3)
Answers: On the front of each DEU
Only on the last DEU mount of each line

Questions.QuestionString: What must be done when DEU mount is replaced (level 3)
Answers: Select the same code as used before on the coding switch of new mount

Questions.QuestionString: How is impedance matching of CIDS top/ middle line done (level 3)
Answers: A resistor is located on the each DEU mount of each line
A resistor is located on the fist DEU mount of each line
A resistor is located on the last DEU mount of each line

Questions.QuestionString: The Passenger Address (PA) allows Voice announcements to be broadcast to all passengers, from the: (level 3)
Answers: Cockpit and cabin attendant stations through the CIDS.
Cabin attendant stations through the CIDS.

Questions.QuestionString: Who can make a passenger announcements via the Passenger Address (PA) System (level 3)
What is audio source priority in PA system? (level 3)
Answers: PA announcements from the cockpit crew, PA announcements from cabin crew, automatic announcements and the boarding music.
PA announcements from the cockpit crew, PA announcements from cabin crew, the boarding music and automatic announcements
PA announcements from the cockpit crew, PA announcements from cabin crew, PA announcements from passenger, the boarding music and automatic announcements

Questions.QuestionString: Where is PA signal sent to (A/C have Passenger Entertainment System)? (level 3)
Answers: Cabin loudspeakers, passenger headset and Cockpit Voice Recorder

Questions.QuestionString: The cockpit handset is mounted on the: (level 2)

The PA transmission key must be pressed and held on the ACP and Push To Talk switch on side stick must be pressed
The PA transmission key must be pressed and held on the ACP and Push To Talk switch on handmic must be pressed

Questions.QuestionString: Which unit provides the amplification function for the cabin loudspeaker? (level 3)
How does cockpit crew have speech when he use oxygen masks (level 3)
Answers: use a built-in microphone of oxygen mask
use the handmike in the cockpit

Questions.QuestionString: The cabin interphone system allows communication between the: (level 3)
Answers: Cockpit and the cabin attendant stations.
Cockpit and the cabin attendant stations, and between the cabin attendant stations.

Questions.QuestionString: Which type of interphone is provided by CIDS? (level 3)
Answers: Flight interphone, cabin interphone and service interphone

Questions.QuestionString: The service interphone system enables communication between the: (level 3)
Answers: Different service interphone jacks and the cockpit.
Different service interphone jacks, the cockpit and the cabin attendant stations.
Different service interphone jacks and the cabin attendant stations.

Questions.QuestionString: What is function of the SERVICE INTERPHONE OVERRIDE P/BSW? (level 3)
Answers: To re-enable the service interphone when A/C in the flight mode.
To connect flight interphone and service interphone.
To disconnect service interphone and cabin interphone.

Questions.QuestionString: Aircraft on ground, in order to communicate from the cockpit to the APU position, you must: (level 3)
Answers: Select the INT on the ACP, and press the “SERV INT” pushbutton.

Questions.QuestionString: How to establish a speech communications between the cockpit, the cabin stations and the jacks? (level 3)
Answers: CAB and INT keys must be pressed on the ACPs in the cockpit
CAB and INT keys must be pressed respectively on the ACPs in the cockpit and on the handset in the cabin
CAB and INT keys must be pressed on the handset in the cabin

Questions.QuestionString: Which key on any AUDIO CONTROL PANEL (ACP), must be pressed to establish a speech communication from the cockpit with the SERVICE INTERPHONE JACKS (level 3)
Where can passenger call be generated? (level 3)

A two positions switch in EVAC control panel set in CAPT: (level 3)
Answers: It allows the system to be triggered either from the cockpit or the cabin.
The system can only be triggered from the cockpit.
The system can only be triggered from the cabin.

Answers: Test and re-program the Cabin Intercommunication Data System.
Test and re-program the cabin lighting systems.

Questions.QuestionString: What happen to CIDS when you have to change the cabin layout (level 3)
Answers: CIDS director hardware, the existing PAX equipment such as loudspeakers and lighting units must be modified
Only the CIDS director hardware is modified, the existing PAX equipment such as loudspeakers and lighting units remain as before
Only the controlling software of CIDS (CAM) is modified, the existing PAX equipment such as loudspeakers and lighting units remain as before

Questions.QuestionString: The cabin loudspeakers are connected to the: (level 3)
Which items are connected to DEU B? (level 3)
Answers: Passenger and cabin attendant related items

Questions.QuestionString: When service BUS has failure, how does the top line cut-off relay de-energize? (level 1)
Answers: Push BAT switch to OFF position.

Questions.QuestionString: How is fail safe operation of DEU A done when a broken wire in one top-line bus happen (enhanced system)? (level 3)
Answers: The sound level of the operable top line is decreased
The sound level of the operable top line is increased
The sound level of the operable top line is increased and effective DEU A is connected to midde-line

Answers: A bus termination resistor is installed in last connection box
A bus termination resistor is installed in first connection box
A code switch resistor is installed in last connection box

Selected the INT transmission key and released out INT reception knob,

To avoid acoustic feedback between the cockpit loudspeakers and the microphones

Questions.QuestionString: In normal case, how is the frequency of ACARS tuned automatically (Not clear) (level 2)

Questions.QuestionString: Is PTT signal from PTT switch on side stick and from hand microphone interchangeable: (Câu hỏi này không có ý nghĩa) (level 3)

Questions.QuestionString: When is the CVR automatically supplied: (Câu này không đúng, đáp án là cho trường hợp Manual supplied) (level 3)
